results.title: Jaipur
results.creator_credit: Shanti Varma, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: The ancient rose-red city of Jaipur and the surrounding country of Rajput. Designed on a grand scale by Jai Singh in 1728, the walled city contains many remarkable temples, gardens and palaces. Nearby is the old palace, with man]gnificent frescoes, inlay work and decorated ceilings. The fort recalls the history of Rajput and its defence against waves of invaders. The observatory built by Jai Singh; collections of manuscripts and paintings; Palace of Winds; craftsmen at work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shanti Varma, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Jailhouse shock
results.creator_credit: Ivor Dunkerton and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
In New Jersey State Prison, a group of hardened inmates conduct a program in which young offenders on probation are confronted with the horrors of prison life - homosexual rape, murder, suicide, etc. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Jailhouse rock
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Pandro S. Berman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The story of a hard-working young man, jailed for manslaughter, finds an outlet for his frustrations in music, and eventually becomes a rock star. Considered to be Elvis Presley’s best film performance “Jailhouse Rock” features many songs by Jerry Liebler and Mike Stollen, including “Jailhouse Rock”, “Treat Me Nice”, and “Baby I Don’t Care”.

results.title: Jail Bait
results.creator_credit: Charles Lamont and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A comedy film starring Buster Keaton. Keaton plays the role of a character who gets caught up in a twisted plot to catch a murderer. Keaton agrees to participate in the plot after being promised a share of the reward money.

results.title: Jaguar
results.brief_description:
Feature film by French film-maker Jean Rouch, filmed in West Africa, about three young men who leave their life of cattle herding in the arid savanna bordering the Sahara, and travel thousands of miles to Ghana (then the Gold Coast) and back again. Rouch uses non-actors who improvise their parts. ‘A brilliant example of the role which creative interpretation can play in ethnographic film-making’. (David MacDougall in Film Quarterly). Dedicated to Gerard Philipe.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Braunberger ; director, Jean Rouch ; music, Enos Amelolon, Tallou Mouzourane, Amisata Gaoudelize, Djenne Molo Kari, Yankori, Ama.
Cast: Damoure Zika, Lam Ibrahima Dia, Illo Gaoudel, Amadou Koffo.

results.title: Jagged edge
results.creator_credit: Richard Marquand, Martin Ransohoff and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A well-crafted, hardboiled mystery with sharp perfromances by murder suspect Jeff Bridges and tough-but-smitten defense attorney Glenn Close. The murder victim was a socialite and heiress. Her husband (James Bridges), an upwardly mobile newspaper publisher, now owns his wife’s fortune. Embittered by past experiences with criminal law, Close is pressed to defend Bridges, once he convinces her of his innocence. This movie raises jagged questions about an imperfect justice system and will leave you guessing until the very end - did he or didn’t he? Robert Loggia received a 1985 Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actor.

results.title: Jafar's blue tiles (Iran)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
The restoration of a 600-year-old brick dome in his village is the focal point of fourteen-year-old Jafar’s interests and activities as he is seen making and installing twelve richly colored tiles that adorn the dome. Told from Jafar’s point of view, explains the significance of the project and the brickmaking process in the culture and customs of his country and captures vistas of the Iranian landscape.

results.title: Jade Snow
results.creator_credit: Ron Finley, Nola Safro, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: The Chinese-American success story of Jade Snow Wong who rejected the traditional role of female subservience to her father and brother and became an accomplished author. Shows the differences in family life-styles between American and Chinese-Americans. Very moving bio-pic of this 5th daughter who graduated with honours, won a State essay prize and worked for the Navy during World War II.

results.title: Jacquot de Nantes [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: This moving homage to filmmaker Jacques Demy (‘Lola’, ‘The Umbrellas of Cherbourg’, ‘The Young girls of Rochefort’), by his wife, filmmaker Agnes Varda, was made with his collaboration but completed after his death in 1990. Scenes enacted from his idyllically happy childhood filmed at the actual locations in his hometown of Nantes, are intercut with Demy’s home movies, his recollections and clips from his films. The film presents an evocative chronicle of the teenage Jacquot’s growing fascination with the cinema culminating in his departure for film school in Paris. Cast includes Philippe Maron, Edouard Joubeaud and Laurent Monnier. In French with English subtitles.
